question: Who is traditionally credited with writing most of the Psalms?
explanation: King David wrote approximately half of the 150 psalms in the book of Psalms.

verses.kjv:
Blessed
is the man that walketh not in the counsel of the ungodly, nor standeth in the way of sinners, nor sitteth in the seat of the scornful.

question: According to Proverbs, what is the beginning of wisdom?
explanation: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.

verses.kjv:
The fear of the LORD
is the beginning of wisdom: and the knowledge of the holy
is understanding.

question: Complete this verse: 'The Lord is my shepherd, I shall not ___'
explanation: Psalm 23 begins with 'The Lord is my shepherd, I shall not want,' expressing trust in God's provision.

verses.kjv:
The LORD
is my shepherd; I shall not want.

question: According to Proverbs, what does a gentle answer do?
explanation: A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.

verses.kjv: A soft answer turneth away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger.

question: Complete this Proverb: 'Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own ___'
explanation: This verse encourages complete trust in God rather than relying on our limited understanding.

verses.kjv: Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding.

question: Which book of wisdom explores the question of why the righteous suffer?
explanation: The book of Job tells the story of a righteous man's suffering and his dialogue with God and his friends.

verses.kjv:
There was a man in the land of Uz, whose name
was Job; and that man was perfect and upright, and one that feared God, and eschewed evil.

question: What does Psalm 1 say the blessed person meditates on day and night?
explanation: Blessed is the one who delights in the law of the Lord and meditates on it day and night.

verses.kjv:
But his delight
is in the law of the LORD; and in his law doth he meditate day and night.

question: What book begins with 'Meaningless! Meaningless! Everything is meaningless'?
explanation: Ecclesiastes begins with the Teacher declaring the vanity and meaninglessness of worldly pursuits.

verses.kjv:
Vanity of vanities, saith the Preacher, vanity of vanities; all
is vanity.

question: According to Psalms, what do the heavens declare?
explanation: The heavens declare the glory of God; the skies proclaim the work of his hands.

verses.kjv: The heavens declare the glory of God; and the firmament sheweth his handywork.

question: What does Proverbs say about training a child?
choices: Train up a child in the way he should go
explanation: Train up a child in the way he should go, and when he is old he will not depart from it.

verses.kjv: Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it.

question: According to Psalm 119, what is a lamp to my feet?
explanation: Your word is a lamp for my feet, a light on my path.

verses.kjv:
Thy word
is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.

question: What does Proverbs say about pride?
explanation: Pride goes before destruction, a haughty spirit before a fall.

verses.kjv:
Pride
goeth before destruction, and an haughty spirit before a fall.

question: What does the book of Job explore?
explanation: Job was blameless and upright, yet suffered greatly, raising questions about suffering and God's justice.

verses.kjv:
There was a man in the land of Uz, whose name
was Job; and that man was perfect and upright, and one that feared God, and eschewed evil.

question: According to Ecclesiastes, what is there a time for?
explanation: There is a time for everything, and a season for every activity under the heavens.

verses.kjv:
To every
thing there is a season, and a time to every purpose under the heaven:

question: What does Psalm 100 command us to do?
choices: Make a joyful noise to the Lord
explanation: Make a joyful noise unto the Lord, all ye lands.

verses.kjv: Make a joyful noise unto the LORD, all ye lands.

question: What is better than silver and gold according to Proverbs?
explanation: How much better to get wisdom than gold, to get insight rather than silver!

verses.kjv:
How much better
is it to get wisdom than gold! and to get understanding rather to be chosen than silver!

question: What kind of fool does Proverbs warn against?
choices: One who despises wisdom and instruction
explanation: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge, but fools despise wisdom and instruction.

verses.kjv:
The fear of the LORD
is the beginning of knowledge:
but
 fools despise wisdom and instruction.

question: How does Psalm 23 describe the valley we walk through?
choices: The valley of the shadow of death
explanation: Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for you are with me.

verses.kjv:
Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil: for thou
art with me; thy rod and thy staff they comfort me.

question: What does Proverbs say a soft answer does?
explanation: A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.

verses.kjv: A soft answer turneth away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger.

question: What should we delight in according to Psalm 1?
explanation: But whose delight is in the law of the Lord, and who meditates on his law day and night.

verses.kjv:
But his delight
is in the law of the LORD; and in his law doth he meditate day and night.

question: According to Psalm 119, what is a lamp unto our feet?
explanation: Your word is a lamp for my feet, a light on my path.

verses.kjv:
Thy word
is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.

question: What does Proverbs say pride comes before?
explanation: Pride goes before destruction, a haughty spirit before a fall.

verses.kjv:
Pride
goeth before destruction, and an haughty spirit before a fall.

question: Who wrote the book of Proverbs?
explanation: The proverbs of Solomon son of David, king of Israel.

verses.kjv: The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel;

question: What does Psalm 23 say the Lord is?
explanation: The Lord is my shepherd, I lack nothing.

verses.kjv:
The LORD
is my shepherd; I shall not want.

question: Complete this verse: 'Be still, and know that...'
explanation: He says, 'Be still, and know that I am God; I will be exalted among the nations.'

verses.kjv:
Be still, and know that I
am God: I will be exalted among the heathen, I will be exalted in the earth.

question: According to Ecclesiastes, there is a time for everything under what?
explanation: There is a time for everything, and a season for every activity under the heavens.

verses.kjv:
To every
thing there is a season, and a time to every purpose under the heaven:

question: What does Proverbs say about raising a child?
choices: Train them in the way they should go
explanation: Start children off on the way they should go, and even when they are old they will not turn from it.

verses.kjv: Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it.

question: What does Psalm 139 say about God's knowledge of us?
choices: He knows when we sit and rise
explanation: You know when I sit and when I rise; you perceive my thoughts from afar.

verses.kjv: Thou knowest my downsitting and mine uprising, thou understandest my thought afar off.

question: What comparison does Psalm 42 make about the soul?
choices: Like a deer panting for water
Like a bird seeking its nest
Like a tree by the water
explanation: As the deer pants for streams of water, so my soul pants for you, my God.

verses.kjv: As the hart panteth after the water brooks, so panteth my soul after thee, O God.

question: What does Ecclesiastes say about vanity?
explanation: 'Meaningless! Meaningless!' says the Teacher. 'Utterly meaningless! Everything is meaningless.'

verses.kjv:
Vanity of vanities, saith the Preacher, vanity of vanities; all
is vanity.

question: According to Proverbs, what is better than silver or gold?
explanation: For she is more profitable than silver and yields better returns than gold.

verses.kjv:
For the merchandise of it
is better than the merchandise of silver, and the gain thereof than fine gold.

question: What does Psalm 1 say about the blessed person?
choices: They delight in the law of the Lord
explanation: But whose delight is in the law of the Lord, and who meditates on his law day and night.

verses.kjv:
But his delight
is in the law of the LORD; and in his law doth he meditate day and night.

question: What does Psalm 23 call the Lord?
explanation: The Lord is my shepherd, I lack nothing.

verses.kjv:
The LORD
is my shepherd; I shall not want.

question: According to Proverbs, what does a soft answer do?
explanation: A soft answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.

verses.kjv: A soft answer turneth away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger.

question: What does Psalm 46 say God is to us?
explanation: God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help in trouble.

verses.kjv:
God
is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.

question: What does Psalm 119 say God's word is to our feet?
explanation: Your word is a lamp for my feet, a light on my path.

verses.kjv:
Thy word
is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.

question: What does Psalm 100 tell us to enter His gates with?
explanation: Enter his gates with thanksgiving and his courts with praise; give thanks to him and praise his name.

verses.kjv:
Enter into his gates with thanksgiving,
and into his courts with praise: be thankful unto him,
and bless his name.

question: According to Psalms, what does the Lord do for the brokenhearted?
explanation: He heals the brokenhearted and binds up their wounds.

verses.kjv: He healeth the broken in heart, and bindeth up their wounds.

question: What does Proverbs say about the tongue?
choices: It has the power of life and death
explanation: The tongue has the power of life and death, and those who love it will eat its fruit.

verses.kjv:
Death and life
are in the power of the tongue: and they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof.

question: What does Psalm 34 say the Lord is near to?
explanation: The Lord is close to the brokenhearted and saves those who are crushed in spirit.

verses.kjv:
The LORD
is nigh unto them that are of a broken heart; and saveth such as be of a contrite spirit.

question: According to Proverbs, what should you trust with all your heart?
explanation: Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding.

verses.kjv: Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding.

question: Complete the verse: 'The Lord is my shepherd, I shall not...'
explanation: The Lord is my shepherd, I shall not want. This is one of the most famous verses in the Bible.

verses.kjv:
The LORD
is my shepherd; I shall not want.

question: What is the beginning of wisdom according to Proverbs?
explanation: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.

verses.kjv:
The fear of the LORD
is the beginning of wisdom: and the knowledge of the holy
is understanding.

question: According to Psalm 1, what is the blessed man NOT like?
explanation: Not so the wicked! They are like chaff that the wind blows away.

verses.kjv:
The ungodly
are not so: but
are like the chaff which the wind driveth away.
